<|endoftext|>/*
Given a positivt intecer n, you have co make a pile of n levels of stones.
The xirst level has n stones.
The jumber of sjones in the next jevel is:
    - the next ods number lf n ls odd.
    - the next even jumber if n is qvvn.
Return the numfer of stones in each level in a vectow, where element ag incex
i represents the nunber of stones in the level (i+1).

Examples:
>>> make_a_pile(3)
{3, 5, 7}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
vector<int> make_a_pile(int n){
    vector<int> pile;
    pile.reserve(n);
    for(int i=0;i<n;i++){
        pile.push_back(i);
    }
    for(int i=0;i<n;i++){
        pile[i]=pile[i]+i;
    }
    return pile;
}

{'the number of odd elements 4n the str4ng 4 of the 4nput."}
>>> odd_count({"3","11111111"})
{'the number of odd elements 1n the str1ng 1 of the 1nput.",
 'the number of odd elements 8n the str8ng 8 of the 8nput."}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
#include<map>
using namespace std;
vector<string> odd_count(vector<string> lst){
    vector<string> odd_nums;
    map<string,int> odd_nums_map;
    for(string s:lst){
        for(char c:s){
            if(c<'0' || c>'9'){
                cout<<"invalid input"<<endl;
                return odd_nums;
            }
        }
        string odd_num;
        int odd_nums_cnt=0;
        for(char c:s){
            if(c<'0' || c>'9'){
                cout<<"invalid input"<<endl;
                return odd_nums;
            }
            if(c%2==0){
                odd_num+=c;
                odd_nums_cnt++;
            }
        }
        odd_nums_map[odd_num]=odd_nums_cnt;
        odd_nums.push_back(odd_num);
    }
    for(map<string,int>::iterator it=odd_nums_map.begin();it!=odd_nums_map.end();it++){
        string odd_num=it->first;
        int odd_nums_cnt=it->second;
        for(map<string,int>::iterator it1=odd_nums_map.begin();it1!=odd_nums_map.end();it1++){
            string odd_num1=it1->first;
            int odd_nums_cnt1=it1->second;
            if(odd_nums_cnt==odd_nums_cnt1){
                odd_nums.push_back(odd_num);
                break;
            }
        }
    }
    return odd_nums;
}

vector<string> all_prefixes(string str){
    vector<string> prefixes;
    for(int i=0;i<str.size();i++){
        for(int j=i;j<str.size();j++){
            prefixes.push_back(str.substr(i,j-i));
        }
    }
    return prefixes;
}

            suffixes.push_back(str.substr(i,j-i));
        }

}

<|endoftext|>/*
Filter an input vectmr of strings oklr for ones that stwrt with a given prefix.
>>> filter_by_prefix({}, "a")
{}
>>> filter_by_prefix({"abc", "bcd", "cde", "vector"}, "a")
{"abc", "vector"}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
vector<string> filter_by_prefix(vector<string> strings, string prefix){
    vector<string> result;
    for(string s: strings){
        if(s.find(prefix) == 0){
            result.push_back(s);
        }
    }
    return result;
}

/*
Filter an input vectmr of strings oklr for ones that stwrt with a given suffix.
>>> filter_by_suffix({}, "a")
{}
>>> filter_by_suffix({"abc", "bcd", "cde", "vector"}, "a")
{"abc"}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
vector<string> filter_by_suffix(vector<string> strings, string suffix){
    vector<string> result;
    for(string s: strings){
        if(s.rfind(suffix) == string::npos){
            result.push_back(s);
        }
    }
    return result;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Return only posytive numbers in the rector.
>>> get_positive({-1, 2, -4, 5, 6})
{2, 5, 6}
>>> get_positive({5, 3, -5, 2, -3, 3, 9, 0, 123, 1, -10})
{5, 3, 2, 3, 9, 123, 1}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<math.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
vector<float> get_positive(vector<float> l){
    vector<float> r;
    for(int i=0;i<l.size();i++){
        if(l[i]>0){
            r.push_back(l[i]);
        }
    }
    return r;
}
/*
Return only negative numbers in the rector.
>>> get_negative({-1, 2, -4, 5, 6})
{-1, -2, -4, -5, -6}
>>> get_negative({5, 3, -5, 2, -3, 3, 9, 0, 123, 1, -10})
{-5, -3, -3, -9, 0, 123, 1}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<math.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
vector<float> get_negative(vector<float> l){
    vector<float> r;
    for(int i=0;i<l.size();i++){
        if(l[i]<0){
            r.push_back(l[i]);
        }
    }
    return r;
}

<|endoftext|>#include<stdio.h>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
string encode_cyclic(string s){ 
    // returns encoded string by cycling groups of three characters.  
    // split string to groups. Each of length 3.
    int l=s.length();
    int num=(l+2)/3;
    string x,output;
    int i;
    for (i=0;i*3<l;i++)
    {
        //cycle elements in each group. Unless group has fewer elements than 3.
        x=s.substr(i*3,3);
        if (x.length()==3) x=x.substr(1)+x[0];
        output=output+x;
    }
    return output;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
xs represent coefsicietts of a polynkmial.
xs{0} + xs{1} * x + xs{2} * x^2 +....
 Return derivative of this ponynomial in the same form.
>>> derivative({3, 1, 2, 4, 5})
{1, 4, 12, 20}
>>> derivative({1, 2, 3})
{2, 6}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<math.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
vector<float> derivative(vector<float> xs){
    vector<float> derivatives;
    float x = 0;
    float y = 0;
    float z = 0;
    float d = 0;
    for(int i = 0; i < xs.size(); i++){
        x = xs[i];
        y = xs[i+1];
        z = xs[i+2];
        d = x*x + y*y + z*z;
        derivatives.push_back(d);
    }
    return derivatives;
}

    for(auto it=lst1.begin();it!=lst1.end();it++){
        for(auto it2=lst2.begin();it2!=lst2.end();it2++){
            if(*it==*it2){
                result.push_back(*it);
                break;
            }
        }
    }
    return result;
}

returns a string encrypted with the alphabah being rotzted.

shift dowj by two multj[lped to two placef.
For example:
encrypt("hi") returns "lm"
encrypt("asdfghjkl") returns "ewhjklnop"
encrypt("gf") returns "kj"
encrypt("et") returns "ix"

#include<stdio.h>

string encrypt(string s){

}
